name: sweet n’ simple scrunchies
notes:
**this is a pay what you want pattern! use the code scrunchie50 for 50% off the original price or use the code scrunchie100 for a free copy. thank you for your support!

introducing the simple 'n sweet scrunchie pattern! perfect for beginners or anyone wanting a quick make, this pattern works up in no time and adds the perfect pop of charm to any hairstyle. whether you're using up leftover yarn or making a batch for gifts or markets, these scrunchies are as easy as they are cute. get ready to create your new favorite hair accessory—simple, sweet, and totally irresistible!

this pattern is super beginner-friendly, and you can whip one up in just about 15 minutes! it’s worked in the round using a 6.5mm hook and super bulky weight yarn—chenille or velvet yarn works best for that soft, plush feel. the pattern includes two size options: one for medium hair and one for thick hair. the smaller size uses standard medium hair ties, while the larger version is made with thick hair ties.

all of my samples were made using the medium size. instructions for the larger size will be noted in parentheses throughout the pattern, like this: s (l). you’ll also find a helpful photo tutorial at the end of the written instructions to guide you step by step.

don’t forget to check out the “possibilities” section before you get started! it’s a fun little space where you can explore different variations and creative ways to customize your scrunchie. my samples all stop after round 2, but i definitely encourage you to experiment and see what you love best!

i want to say a huge thank you to my wonderful testers [handmadeknitwear](/people/handmadeknitwear), [miatkic](/people/miatkic), [geeguess](/people/geeguess), [maylina](/people/maylina), and [psalmsandstitches](/people/psalmsandstitches)! this pattern wouldn’t be possible without you :)  

thank you for choosing my pattern, i hope you enjoyed it. if you enjoyed this pattern, you may be interested in some of my other patterns–you can check them out [here][1] :) you may sell as many of the finished items as you wish, but if you share on social media please give me credit @elly donner on ravelry and link the pattern to its source. if you have any questions or need pattern support, please contact me [here][2] @stopitharry on ravelry. i appreciate your support!
